means: 重要的事物[人]，有一定意义的事物
（表示不确切的描述或数量）大致，左右

sentence.Network_en: A miracle is something that seems impossible but happens anyway.
sentence.Network_cn: 奇迹就是看似不可能，却发生了。

sentence.Network_en: No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

sentence.Network_en: If you're not satisfied with the life you're living, don't just complain. Do something about it.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于现况的不满，不能只是抱怨，要有勇气作出改变。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)added as a reference to an unspecified alternative similar to the thing mentioned

lj.lj_ly: you look like you just climbed a mountain or something.
lj.lj_ls: 你看上去好像刚爬过山或是什么的。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)不寻常的事；值得注意的事
(非正式)异常的人（或事）；特别出色的人（或事）

lj.lj_ly: the reaction from the crowd was something else.
the reaction from the crowd was something else.

jx.jx_en_mean: —— is worth considering; there is some truth in ——

lj.lj_ly: people think I'm stupid because I think there's something in this alien business.
lj.lj_ls: 人们觉得我蠢笨，因为我觉得这个外国企业真的值得考虑。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)an unspecified age between thirty and forty (forty and fifty, etc.)
One that is very special or quite remarkable
jx.jx_cn_mean: 非常特殊或者非常了不起的人（或事物）

lj.lj_ly: Her new film is something else.
Our professor is something of an eccentric.
lj.lj_ls: 我们教授的性情多少有点儿古怪

encyclopedia.content: 歌曲介绍 something是披头士最后一张专辑abbey road中的一首歌曲，也是专辑中极为优秀的单曲之一。这首歌由乐队的主吉他手George Harrison创作并演唱，在1969年10月6日在英国发行为单曲。 在英国榜达到了#4，在美国榜到达了#1。 这首歌曲是乔治哈里森最成功的单曲之一，最终单曲获得了美国唱片协会2白金的销售认证。 该曲也被认为是披头士乐队在“yesterday”后最成功的单曲，被很多的音乐家翻唱过，包括猫王、Eric Clapton和Jame

entry.tran: 某物，某事(指事物、情况、事件、想法等)
entry.def: You use something to refer to a thing, situation, event, or idea, without saying exactly what it is.

example.ex: He realized right away that there was something wrong...
example.tran: 他马上意识到什么地方出了问题。

example.ex: There was something vaguely familiar about him...
example.tran: 他身上有着某种似曾相识的东西。

entry.tran: (描述、数量等)大概，大致，大约，左右
entry.def: You can use something to say that the description or amount that you are giving is not exact.

example.ex: He described the smell as something between a circus and a seaport...
example.tran: 他形容那种气味介于马戏团和海港的味道之间。

example.ex: Clive made a noise, something like a grunt...
example.tran: 克莱夫发出一种声响，像是咕哝了一句。

entry.def: If you say that a person or thing is something or is really something, you mean that you are very impressed by them.

example.ex: The doors here are really something, all made of good wood like mahogany...
example.tran: 这些门真是极品，全部由红木一类的优质木材加工而成。

entry.tran: 聊以自慰的事;还算幸运的事
entry.def: You can use something in expressions like 'that's something' when you think that a situation is not very good but is better that it might have been.

example.ex: Well, at least he was in town. That was something...
example.tran: 好啦，至少他在城里，还算幸运。

example.ex: Well, you're staying. That's something I suppose.
example.tran: 啊，你准备留下来了。我想这算是能够聊以自慰吧。

entry.def: If you say that a thing is something of a disappointment, you mean that it is quite disappointing. If you say that a person is something of an artist, you mean that they are quite good at art.

example.ex: The city proved to be something of a disappointment...
example.tran: 结果这座城市有点儿令人失望。

example.ex: She received something of a surprise when Robert said that he was coming to New York...
example.tran: 当罗伯特说他就要来纽约的时候，她有点吃惊。

entry.tran: (想法或建议)有道理，值得考虑
entry.def: If you say that there is something in an idea or suggestion, you mean that it is quite good and should be considered seriously.

example.ex: Christianity has stood the test of time, so there must be something in it...
example.tran: 基督教经受住了时间的考验，因此其中一定是有些道理的。

example.ex: There had been something in Des's first statement...
example.tran: 德斯最初的陈述有些道理。

entry.tran: (表示对说的话不能肯定)或别的什么，或诸如此类
entry.def: You use something in expressions such as 'or something' and 'or something like that' to indicate that you are referring to something similar to what you have just mentioned but you are not being exact.

example.ex: This guy, his name was Briarly or Beardly or something...
example.tran: 这个家伙叫布赖厄利、比尔德利或什么类似的名字。

example.ex: The air fare was about a hundred and ninety-nine pounds or something like that.
example.tran: 机票 199 英镑左右，大概是这个价钱。

list.explanation: 保守某事物的秘密，对某事物保密

example.en: We wanted to hush up the whole story, but there was no way to do it.
example.zh: 我们本来想对全部真情保密，似是没办法做到。

list.explanation: 确认、辨明或选定(某事物)

example.en: I can't quite pin my feeling down.
example.zh: 我很难弄清楚自己的感觉。

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)有能力完成某事的

example.en: He is not able to cut his responsibilities like we thought.
example.zh: 如我们所料，他没有能力完成他的职责。

example.en: Do you think you're able to cut it?
example.zh: 你觉得你能完成这亊吗？

list.explanation: 将某物装饰打扮得更漂亮

example.en: We zazzed up the room before they came.
example.zh: 在他们来之前，我们把房间好好收拾了一下。

list.explanation: (常与get连用)欣赏或享用某事物

example.en: Let's get down with some good music.
example.zh: 让我们来欣赏一些优美动听的音乐。

example.en: Pete wanted to get down with some grapes.
I was down with the flu for two weeks.
example.zh: 我患流感，病了两个星期。

list.explanation: 损害，毁坏，损坏某物的原因

example.en: This kind of road is just death on tyres.
example.zh: 这种道路最容易磨损汽车轮胎。

example.en: This candy is death on my teeth.
example.zh: 这种糖果是坏我牙齿的祸根。

list.explanation: (乘某种交通工具)快速运行、行进

example.en: He is way fast——just death on wheels.
example.zh: 他很快地离去了——乘汽车匪快地走了。

example.en: Pete is death on skis. You ought to see him go.
example.zh: 皮特蹬上滑雪板飞快地走了。你应该看见他走的。

list.explanation: 对某事发生兴趣，迷上某事物

example.en: I got into computers when I was in junior high school.
example.zh: 我念初中时就迷上计算机了。

example.en: When did you get into foreign films?
example.zh: 你什么时候迷上外国电影的？

list.explanation: 同意或答应干某事，(开始)认真处理、紧紧抓住某事

example.en: I can't wait to get my teeth into that Wallace job.
example.zh: 我想尽快接手华莱士干的那份差事。

example.en: Here. Sink your teeth into this and see if you can manage this project.
example.zh: 现在，开始好好十这事吧，者看你是否能够完成这个计划。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Liquidity How easy something is to convert into cash.

auth_sentence.content: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.

auth_sentence.content: Gi Hop is a wrench into something more upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Gi Hop is a wrench into something more upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gi Hop is a wrench into something more upbeat.

sentences.en: I have something important to tell you.
sentences.cn: 我有些重要的事要告诉你。

means.word_mean: 重要的事物[人], 有一定意义的事物

sentences.cn: 他认为自己是个了不起的人。

sentences.en: Money is something, but it is not everything.
sentences.cn: 钱很重要, 但钱并不是一切。

jushi.english: Would you like something to eat?
Something is wrong with the computer.
